meanings.definition: Believing oneself to be inherently deserving of privileges or special treatment.
meanings.sent1: She felt entitled to extra dessert because she thought she deserved it.
meanings.sent2: The entitled customer demanded to speak to the manager for no reason.
meanings.sent3: The entitled cat refused to eat anything but gourmet food.
meanings.sent4: The entitled student expected top grades without putting in any effort.
meanings.sent5: The entitled prince acted as if the world revolved around him.

meanings.sent1: He was entitled to a refund according to the store's policy.
meanings.sent2: The workers were entitled to fair wages for their hard work.
meanings.sent3: The dog felt entitled to the last piece of bacon on the plate.
meanings.sent4: She felt entitled to the truth after being lied to multiple times.
meanings.sent5: The citizens were entitled to express their opinions freely.

meanings.definition: Giving a title to a book, movie, etc.
meanings.sent1: The author was proud to see her name as the entitled of the bestseller.
meanings.sent2: The film director carefully chose the entitled for his new movie.
meanings.sent3: The students were excited to discuss the entitled of the upcoming film.
meanings.sent4: The committee debated the best entitled for the annual event.
meanings.sent5: The artist designed the perfect entitled for her latest masterpiece.
